subject: p18287845
History: -year-old man with fever and hypoxia. Evaluate for pneumonia.
Findings: PA and lateral chest radiograph is provided. There is no focal consolidation, pleural effusion or pneumothorax. Bibasilar opacities are present, more prominent on the left, which most likely represents atelectasis. A pacemaker is seen with leads in appropriate positioning. There are surgical clips seen in the epigastric area.
Impression: No acute cardiopulmonary process. Bibasilar opacities most likely representing atelectasis.
